Software License

Except where otherwise noted, all of the documentation and software included in this Software package is copyrighted by IPP Max-Planck-Institute.

This software is provided "as-is," without any express or implied warranty. In no event shall the author be held liable for any damages arising from the use of this software.

Copyright © 2005-2011 IPP Max-Planck-Institut für Plasmaphysik.
All rights reserved. http://www.ipp.mpg.de

If you are working in IPP consider the following steps before transferring this software to somebody:

  • write the letter to the administration: Vorlage an das Direktorium (z.B. Begründung: Die Weitergabe erfolgt im Rahmen der Zusammenarbeit....)
  • attach Merkblatt zur Weitergabe von Computer Software an andere wissenschaftliche Einrichtungen
  • attach one of the Anlage zur Direktoriumsvorlage, see below

You can find these forms in IPP internal network.
Das Formular ist im Intranet unter Anträge und im Sekretariat der Rechts- und Patentabteilung (Tel: 1425) erhältlich.

Anlage zur Direktoriumsvorlage vom:

Antragsteller

GENERAL CONDITIONS FOR THE USE OF COMPUTER SOFTWARE
1. IPP allows the undersigning party (Name of Institution) to use this computer software provided that this software will be used exclusively for non-commercial research purposes.

2. The undersigning party agrees, therefore, not to exploit this software commercially or to transfer it to third parties without prior written consent of IPP.

3. The undersigning party agrees, not to use the software for military purposes or any other purpose falling under the provisions for non-proliferation.

4. IPP provides no guarantee that the software is in good running order. No liability can be accepted for damage or injury arising from use of the software. Furthermore, IPP provides no guarantee that the use of the computer software will not involve any infringement of copyright. The undersigning party will notify IPP when it discovers that the software contains any error or infringes any copyright.

5. The undersigning party will, on request, put programs developed from the IPP software at the disposal of IPP under the same conditions. Furthermore the undersigning party agrees to state the names of IPP and of the program provided when publishing research results obtained with the aid of this computer software.

6. Transfer of the software will involve no costs for IPP.

Date           Signatures

Antragsteller

GENERAL CONDITIONS FOR THE USE OF COMPUTER SOFTWARE DERIVING FROM OPEN-SOURCE LICENCED SOFTWARE
(i.e. GNU General Public License or Free Documentation License)
1. IPP grants the undersigning party (Name of Institution) the following rights for this computer software exclusively under the conditions of the open-source license: to use, to copy, to distribute and to modify the computer software and to copy and distribute such modifications provided that the open-source license, the copyright notices, the license notice (saying that the license applies to the software) and the disclaimer of warranty are reproduced in all copies.

2. The undersigning party may not use technical measures to obstruct or control the reading or further copying of the copies you make or distribute.

3. The undersigning party agrees not to use the software for military purposes or any other purpose falling under the provisions for non-proliferation.

4. IPP provides no warranty that the software is in good running order. No liability can be accepted for damage or injury arising from use of the software. Furthermore, IPP provides no guarantee that the use of the computer software will not involve any infringement of copyright. The undersigning party will notify IPP when it discovers that the software contains any error or infringes any copyright.

5. The undersigning party will, on request, put programs developed from the IPP software at the disposal of IPP under the same conditions. Furthermore the undersigning party agrees to state the names of IPP and of the program provided when publishing research results obtained with the aid of this computer software.

6. Transfer of the software will involve no costs for IPP.
